Dear Group,

I would much appreciate some help on compiling cantera under L=
inux
(RedHat ES 4, python 2.4.3, gcc 3.4.6). I've been running Cantera with=

Python on Windows for a while, but now I need to move some jobs off of
my =
desktop to a workstation. I get a successful build except for
Cantera Pytho=
n. 

I checked out the cantera source using cvs today. I also installed the=

most recent version of numarray and modified the preconfig script so
it kn=
ows where to find it. 

After getting the message from 'make install' that =
Cantera Python
wasn't installed, I ran 'make python' (says nothing to updat=
e) and
'make python-install', which gives the following error message...


=
building 'Cantera._cantera' extension
c++ -pthread -shared build/temp.linux=
-i686-2.3/src/pycantera.o
-L/home/paul/research/cantera/build/lib/i686-pc-l=
inux-gnu
-L/home/paul/research/cantera/build/lib/i686-pc-linux-gnu -lclib
-=
lzeroD -loneD -ltransport -lcantera -lconverters -lcaThermo
-lctlapack -lct=
blas -lcvode -lctmath -ltpx -lctf2c -lctf2c -lm -o
build/lib.linux-i686-2.3=
/Cantera/_cantera.so
/home/paul/research/cantera/build/lib/i686-pc-linux-gn=
u/libclib.a(ctfunc.o)(.bss+0x0):
multiple definition of `Cabinet<Cantera::F=
unc1>::__storage'
/home/paul/research/cantera/build/lib/i686-pc-linux-gnu/l=
ibclib.a(ctreactor.o)(.bss+0x0):
first defined here
/home/paul/research/can=
tera/build/lib/i686-pc-linux-gnu/libclib.a(ctxml.o)(.bss+0x0):
multiple def=
inition of `Cabinet<Cantera::XML_Node>::__storage'
/home/paul/research/cant=
era/build/lib/i686-pc-linux-gnu/libclib.a(ct.o)(.bss+0x0):
first defined he=
re
collect2: ld returned 1 exit status

Do I need to change some compiler f=
lags to allow multiple definitions?
Other aspects of cantera seem to be wor=
king. I ran 'make test' and the
 C++ examples and ck2cti both work. (Actual=
ly the C++ example 'kin2'
fails, but on closer inspection I think that's b/=
c the first line of
kin2_blessed.csv should say 'kinetics example 2' instea=
d of 'kinetics
example 1'.)

Thanks in advance for your help!

Best,
Paul
